title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: Forsyth was an ardent, unrepentant Thatcherite in what was supposed to be a post-Thatcherite age. The story was that when the civil servants at St Andrew's House heard of  his appointment they went around picking windows to leave by. Forsyth had been a hate fi gure as a junior minister and as Secretary of  State he attracted greater unpopularity.
